Class UserDialog

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JOptionPane
                  UserDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class UserDialog
extends javax.swing.JOptionPane

Defines simple dialog boxes for interacting with the user, by extending JOptionPane. It is able to show a simple string message, get an integer, float, double, boolean or string from the user, or get the user to confirm "yes" or "no". User input is converted to the appropriate type. If an inappropriate type is input, an error dialog box is displayed, and a default value returned.

Version:
1.2 07/12/03
Author:
(adapted from an original example by Ken Brown)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

UserDialog

public UserDialog()
Method Detail

getBoolean

public boolean getBoolean(java.lang.String output)
Displays a message and asks the user to click "yes", "no" or "cancel". If the user clicks "cancel", "false" is returned. Implemented using showConfirmDialog.

getBooleanText

public boolean getBooleanText(java.lang.String text,
                              java.lang.String question)
Displays a text message in a text box inside the dialog box, and a question, and returns a boolean provided by the user. If the user does not provide a boolean, a default value (false) returned.

getDouble

public double getDouble(java.lang.String output)
Displays a message and returns a double provided by the user. If the user does not provide a double, an error dialog box is displayed, and a default value returned.

getDoubleText

public double getDoubleText(java.lang.String text,
                            java.lang.String question)
Displays a text message in a text box inside the dialog box, and a question, and returns a double provided by the user. If the user does not provide a double, an error dialog box is displayed, and a default value (-1.0) returned.

getFloat

public float getFloat(java.lang.String output)
Displays a message and returns a float provided by the user. If the user does not provide a float, an error dialog box is displayed, and a default value returned.

getFloatText

public float getFloatText(java.lang.String text,
                          java.lang.String question)
Displays a text message in a text box inside the dialog box, and a question, and returns a float provided by the user. If the user does not provide a float, an error dialog box is displayed, and a default value (-1.0) returned.

getInt

public int getInt(java.lang.String output)
Displays a message and returns an int provided by the user. If the user does not provide an int, an error dialog box is displayed, and a default value returned.

getIntText

public int getIntText(java.lang.String text,
                      java.lang.String question)
Displays a text message in a text box inside the dialog box, and a question, and returns an int provided by the user. If the user does not provide an int, an error dialog box is displayed, and a default value (-1) returned.

getString

public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String output)
Displays a message and returns a String provided by the user.

getStringText

public java.lang.String getStringText(java.lang.String text,
                                      java.lang.String question)
Displays a text message in a text box inside the dialog box, and a question, and returns a string provided by the user. If the user does not provide a string, an error dialog box is displayed, and a default value (null) returned.

selectIndex

public int selectIndex(java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.Object[] options)
Displays a range of possible strings to the user, and asks the user to select one. The index of the string in the array of options will be returned, or -1 if the user doesn't select one.

selectObject

public java.lang.Object selectObject(java.lang.String message,
                                     java.lang.Object[] possibleValues)
Displays a range of possible objects to the user, and asks the user to select one. If the user does not select one, the null String will be returned. This assumes each object has implemented a toString() method.

selectString

public java.lang.String selectString(java.lang.String message,
                                     java.lang.String[] options)
Displays a range of possible strings to the user, and asks the user to select one. If the user does not select one, the null String will be returned.

showMessage

public void showMessage(java.lang.String output)
Displays a simple String object.

showTextMessage

public void showTextMessage(java.lang.String message)
Displays a text message in a 10x20 text box inside the dialog box

showTextMessage

public void showTextMessage(java.lang.String message,
                            int rows,
                            int cols)
Displays a text message in a text box inside the dialog box Text box dimensions set by the user
